examples.sentence: Immerse in authentic materials - Read novels, newspapers, academic texts
Learn classical patterns - Many N1 patterns have classical origins
Master formal registers - Understand keigo and written language
Study in context - These patterns are rarely used in isolation
Practice extensively - Output is crucial at this level
Listen to formal speeches and lectures
Engage in academic or professional writing

sections.heading: JLPT N1 Grammar Overview
sections.content: JLPT N1 represents near-native proficiency in Japanese. It covers highly specialized grammar, literary expressions, formal written language, and nuanced patterns rarely used in daily conversation. N1 grammar appears in academic texts, literature, legal documents, and sophisticated journalism. This level includes approximately 250+ advanced grammar points.

children.heading: 〜が早いか - As soon as/No sooner than
children.content: ベルが鳴るが早いか、駆け出した。 Beru ga naru ga hayai ka, kakedashita. "No sooner had the bell rung than they dashed out."

children.heading: 〜や否や - As soon as/The moment
children.content: 家に着くや否や、電話が鳴った。 Ie ni tsuku ya ina ya, denwa ga natta. "The moment I arrived home, the phone rang."

children.heading: 〜そばから - No sooner... than/As soon as
children.content: 覚えたそばから忘れる。 Oboeta sobakara wasureru. "I forget as soon as I learn."

children.heading: 〜なり - As soon as/Immediately upon
children.content: 帰るなり寝てしまった。 Kaeru nari nete shimatta. "I fell asleep as soon as I got home."

children.heading: 〜が最後 - Once... (negative result)
children.content: 座ったが最後、動けなくなる。 Suwatta ga saigo, ugokenaku naru. "Once you sit down, you won't be able to move."

children.heading: 〜極まる/〜極まりない - Extremely
children.content: 不愉快極まりない。 Fuyukai kiwamarinai. "Extremely unpleasant."

children.heading: 〜の至り - Extremely (formal)
children.content: 光栄の至りです。 Kouei no itari desu. "It's an extreme honor."

children.heading: 〜の極み - The height of/Utmost
children.content: 幸せの極みだ。 Shiawase no kiwami da. "The height of happiness."

children.heading: 〜にたえない - Cannot bear/Unbearable
children.content: 感謝に堪えない。 Kansha ni taenai. "I cannot express enough gratitude."

children.heading: 〜てたまらない/〜てならない - Cannot help but/Extremely
children.content: 心配でたまらない。 Shinpai de tamaranai. "I'm extremely worried."

children.heading: 〜にほかならない - Nothing but/None other than
children.content: これは事実にほかならない。 Kore wa jijitsu ni hoka naranai. "This is nothing but fact."

children.heading: 〜までもない - There's no need to/Needless to say
children.content: 言うまでもない。 Iu made mo nai. "Needless to say."

children.heading: 〜ないまでも - Even if not/If not... at least
children.content: 成功しないまでも、努力は認められる。 Seikou shinai made mo, doryoku wa mitomerareru. "Even if not successful, the effort is recognized."

children.heading: 〜といえども - Even though/Even if
children.content: 専門家といえども間違える。 Senmonka to iedomo machigaeru. "Even experts make mistakes."

children.heading: 〜ならでは - Unique to/Only... can
children.content: プロならではの技術。 Puro naradewa no gijutsu. "Technique unique to professionals."

children.heading: 〜ともあろうものが - Someone of... status
children.content: 先生ともあろうものが嘘をついた。 Sensei tomo arou mono ga uso wo tsuita. "Someone of teacher status told a lie."

children.heading: 〜ようが〜まいが - Whether... or not
children.content: 雨が降ろうが降るまいが行く。 Ame ga furou ga furu mai ga iku. "Whether it rains or not, I'll go."

children.heading: 〜たりとも - Even (not)
children.content: 一瞬たりとも油断できない。 Isshun tari tomo yudan dekinai. "Cannot let guard down even for a moment."

children.heading: 〜たところで - Even if/No matter how
children.content: 今更謝ったところで遅い。 Imasara ayamatta tokoro de osoi. "Even if you apologize now, it's too late."

children.heading: 〜とあって - Because of/Due to (special circumstance)
children.content: 休日とあって人が多い。 Kyuujitsu to atte hito ga ooi. "Because it's a holiday, there are many people."

children.heading: 〜をもって - With/By means of (formal)
children.content: 本日をもって閉店いたします。 Honjitsu wo motte heiten itashimasu. "We will close as of today."

children.heading: 〜をおいて - Other than/Except
children.content: 彼をおいて適任者はいない。 Kare wo oite tekininsha wa inai. "There's no one suitable other than him."

children.heading: 〜ならではの - Unique to/Characteristic of
children.content: 京都ならではの風景。 Kyouto naradewa no fuukei. "Scenery unique to Kyoto."

children.heading: 〜たるもの - One who is/As someone who is
children.content: 学生たるもの勉強すべきだ。 Gakusei taru mono benkyou subeki da. "As a student, one should study."

children.heading: 〜んばかりに - As if about to/Almost
children.content: 泣かんばかりの顔をしている。 Nakan bakari no kao wo shite iru. "Has a face as if about to cry."

children.heading: 〜ないではすまない - Cannot get away with not
children.content: 謝罪しないでは済まない。 Shazai shinai dewa sumanai. "Cannot get away without apologizing."

children.heading: 〜ないではおかない - Cannot leave/Will not fail to
children.content: 彼は約束を守らないではおかない。 Kare wa yakusoku wo mamoranai dewa okanai. "He will not fail to keep his promise."

children.heading: 〜までだ - That's all/Simply
children.content: やってみるまでだ。 Yatte miru made da. "I'll simply try it."

children.heading: 〜たが最後 - Once... (then it's over)
children.content: 飲み始めたが最後、止まらない。 Nomihajimeta ga saigo, tomaranai. "Once I start drinking, I can't stop."

children.heading: 〜をよそに - In defiance of/Ignoring
children.content: 反対をよそに計画を進めた。 Hantai wo yoso ni keikaku wo susumeta. "Proceeded with the plan ignoring opposition."

children.heading: 〜もさることながら - Not only... but also
children.content: 味もさることながら、見た目も美しい。 Aji mo saru koto nagara, mitame mo utsukushii. "Not only the taste but also the appearance is beautiful."

children.heading: 〜ともなく/〜ともなしに - Without particularly/Casually
children.content: 何気なく見るともなく見ていた。 Nanigenaku miru tomo naku mite ita. "Was watching casually without particularly watching."

children.heading: 〜をものともせずに - In spite of/Undaunted by
children.content: 困難をものともせずに挑戦した。 Konnan wo mono tomo sezu ni chousen shita. "Challenged undaunted by difficulties."

children.heading: 〜てからというもの - Ever since
children.content: 結婚してからというもの、幸せだ。 Kekkon shite kara to iu mono, shiawase da. "Ever since getting married, I've been happy."

children.heading: 〜が否や - As soon as/No sooner than
children.content: 聞くが否や駆けつけた。 Kiku ga ina ya kaketsuketa. "Rushed over as soon as I heard."

children.heading: 〜ことゆえ - Because/Since (formal)
children.content: 初めてのことゆえ、失敗した。 Hajimete no koto yue, shippai shita. "Because it was my first time, I failed."

children.heading: 〜手前 - For the sake of/Considering
children.content: 約束した手前、断れない。 Yakusoku shita temae, kotowarenai. "Considering I promised, I can't refuse."

children.heading: 〜いかんによらず - Regardless of
children.content: 理由のいかんによらず許されない。 Riyuu no ikan ni yorazu yurusarenai. "Regardless of the reason, it's unforgivable."

children.heading: 〜いかんにかかわらず - Regardless of/Irrespective of
children.content: 結果のいかんにかかわらず最善を尽くす。 Kekka no ikan ni kakawarazu saizen wo tsukusu. "Do one's best regardless of the result."

children.heading: 〜いかんによっては - Depending on
children.content: 状況いかんによっては中止する。 Joukyou ikan ni yotte wa chuushi suru. "Depending on the situation, will cancel."

children.heading: 〜をものともせず - Despite/In spite of
children.content: 雨をものともせず進んだ。 Ame wo mono tomo sezu susunda. "Proceeded despite the rain."

children.heading: 〜とはいえ - Although/Though/Having said that
children.content: 便利とはいえ、高すぎる。 Benri to wa ie, takasugiru. "Although convenient, it's too expensive."

children.heading: 〜とはいうものの - Although one says/Though
children.content: 合格したとはいうものの、点数は低かった。 Goukaku shita to wa iu mono no, tensuu wa hikakatta. "Although I passed, my score was low."

children.heading: 〜ながらに/〜ながらの - While being/While remaining
children.content: 生まれながらの才能。 Umarenagara no sainou. "Innate talent."

children.heading: 〜べく - In order to/For the purpose of
children.content: 成功すべく努力する。 Seikou subeku doryoku suru. "Make efforts in order to succeed."

children.heading: 〜んがため - In order to/For the purpose of
children.content: 勝たんがために練習する。 Katan ga tame ni renshuu suru. "Practice in order to win."

children.heading: 〜んとして - Trying to/Attempting to
children.content: 逃げんとして走った。 Nigen to shite hashitta. "Ran trying to escape."

children.heading: 〜めく - Have the appearance of/-ish
children.content: 春めいた天気。 Harumeita tenki. "Spring-like weather."

children.heading: 〜気味 - Slightly/Somewhat
children.content:
See: 〜気味 (Slightly/Tending)

疲れ気味だ。 Tsukare gimi da. "Feeling somewhat tired."

children.heading: 〜じみた - -ish/Like
children.content: 子供じみた行動。 Kodomo jimita koudou. "Childish behavior."

children.heading: 〜をはじめ/〜をはじめとして - Starting with/Including
children.content: 社長をはじめ全員が参加した。 Shachou wo hajime zen'in ga sanka shita. "Everyone participated, starting with the president."

children.heading: 〜を問わず - Regardless of/Irrespective of
children.content: 年齢を問わず参加できる。 Nenrei wo towazu sanka dekiru. "Can participate regardless of age."

children.heading: 〜ならず - Not only... but also
children.content: 国内ならず海外でも有名だ。 Kokunai narazu kaigai demo yuumei da. "Famous not only domestically but also overseas."

children.heading: 〜かたがた - While/On the occasion of
children.content: お礼かたがた訪問した。 Orei katagata houmon shita. "Visited while expressing thanks."

children.heading: 〜からある/〜からする - As much as/At least
children.content: 1メートルからある魚。 Ichi meetoru kara aru sakana. "A fish at least one meter long."

sections.heading: Study Tips for N1 Grammar
sections.content: Immerse in authentic materials - Read novels, newspapers, academic texts Learn classical patterns - Many N1 patterns have classical origins Master formal registers - Understand keigo and written language Study in context - These patterns are rarely used in isolation Practice extensively - Output is crucial at this level

sections.heading: Preparation Resources
sections.content: Read literary works and essays Study formal business documents Practice academic writing Listen to formal speeches and lectures Engage with native materials extensively

sections.heading: Beyond N1
sections.content:
After mastering N1:

Continue reading challenging materials Study classical Japanese if interested Master regional dialects Perfect business Japanese Engage in academic or professional writing

Note: N1 represents near-native proficiency. Many patterns are literary or extremely formal. Focus on recognition and appropriate usage contexts.
